Course Title                                Major : Object Oriented Programming Methodology
      Credit                                                     3 (Theory) + 1 (Practical)
    Teaching                                               3hrs (Theory) + 2hrs (Practical)
    per Week                                                                            NaN
     Minimum             15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
   weeks per                                                                            NaN

 Last Review                                                                            ---

         NaN   To develop the understanding of object-oriented programming concepts through
  Purpose of                   programming using java as the computer programming language.
      Course                                                                            NaN
         NaN            ● To learn inheritance, polymorphism, abstraction and encapsulation
         NaN                                         ● To understand the utility of package
      Course                                                  ● To learn exception handling
   Objective                                                                            NaN
        Pre-                                                             Programming basics
   requisite                                                                            NaN
         NaN  At the end of the course, student is expected to have understanding about the
  Course Out concepts of object-oriented programming, inheritance, polymorphism, interfaces
        come                                                                   and packages
         NaN              Unit 1 Introduction to Object oriented programming in java[8 hrs]
         NaN                                               1.1  Object oriented programming
         NaN                                 1.2  Structured vs object-oriented programming
         NaN                                     1.3  Object oriented programming languages
         NaN           1.4  Overview of object-oriented programming features – data hiding,
         NaN                          abstraction, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism
         NaN                                                       1.5  Classes and objects
         NaN                                    1.6  Class attributes/variables and methods
         NaN                                                     1.7  Calling class methods
         NaN                     1.8  Calling user defined class methods without parameters
      Course     1.9  Calling user defined class methods with primitive datatype parameters
     Content              1.10 Calling user defined class methods with object as parameters
         NaN                            1.11 Access modifiers and its usage for data hiding
         NaN                                                                            NaN
         NaN                Unit 2 Object - construction, accessibility and clean-up[7 hrs]
         NaN                                                  2.1 Constructor and its types
         NaN                                                      2.1.1 Default constructor

Unnamed: 0 2.1.2 Parameterized constructor\r2.1.3 Copy constructor\r2.2 Garbage collection in java\r2.3 new() and finalize() methods\r2.4 static keyword – static variables and methods\r2.5 this keyword\r2.6 Array of objects\r\rUnit 3 Exception handling in java                                                                 [6 hrs]\r3.1 Need of exception handling\r3.2 Types of exceptions\r3.3 Try... catch block\r3.4 Finally clause\r3.5 Throw clause\r3.6 Throws clause\r\rUnit 4 Inheritance                                                                                           [7 hrs]\r4.1 Importance of inheritance in object-oriented programming\r4.2 Types of inheritance\r4.2.1\rSingle\r4.2.2\rMultilevel\r4.2.3\rHierarchical\r4.2.4     Multiple (using interface)\r4.2.5     Hybrid\r4.3 Use of super keyword\r4.4 Order of calling constructors\r\rUnit 5 Polymorphism                                                                                    [4 hrs]\r5.1 Method overloading\r5.2 Method overriding and dynamic binding\r5.3  Using Final keyword to prevent overriding and inheritance\r\rUnit 6 Encapsulation and packages in java                                                [7 hrs]\r6.1 Significance of Encapsulation\r6.2 What is a package?\r6.3 Importance of package\r6.4 Creating and accessing package in java\r6.5 Adding classes to package\r6.6 Inbuilt packages – Java.util, Java.lang, Java.io                                                           Unnamed: 1

2.1.2 Parameterized constructor\r2.1.3 Copy constructor\r2.2 Garbage collection in java\r2.3 new() and finalize() methods\r2.4 static keyword – static variables and methods\r2.5 this keyword\r2.6 Array of objects\r\rUnit 3 Exception handling in java                                                                 [6 hrs]\r3.1 Need of exception handling\r3.2 Types of exceptions\r3.3 Try... catch block\r3.4 Finally clause\r3.5 Throw clause\r3.6 Throws clause\r\rUnit 4 Inheritance                                                                                           [7 hrs]\r4.1 Importance of inheritance in object-oriented programming\r4.2 Types of inheritance\r4.2.1\rSingle\r4.2.2\rMultilevel\r4.2.3\rHierarchical\r4.2.4     Multiple (using interface)\r4.2.5     Hybrid\r4.3 Use of super keyword\r4.4 Order of calling constructors\r\rUnit 5 Polymorphism                                                                                    [4 hrs]\r5.1 Method overloading\r5.2 Method overriding and dynamic binding\r5.3  Using Final keyword to prevent overriding and inheritance\r\rUnit 6 Encapsulation and packages in java                                                [7 hrs]\r6.1 Significance of Encapsulation\r6.2 What is a package?\r6.3 Importance of package\r6.4 Creating and accessing package in java\r6.5 Adding classes to package\r6.6 Inbuilt packages – Java.util, Java.lang, Java.io                                                           Unnamed: 0

   Purpose of                This course imparts the knowledge of Procedural SQL
       Course                                                                NaN

Course Objective                                                                To give exposure of
             NaN                                                        ● SQL Joins and SubQueries,
             NaN                                                        ● PL/SQL for handling data,
             NaN                                                  ● Transaction Management concepts
    Pr-requisite                             Understanding of basic Database concepts, DDL, and DML
 Course Out come                                                           Students will be able to
             NaN                                         ● Efficiently use PL/SQL for handling data
             NaN                ● Create and invoke user defined procedures, functions and triggers
  Course Content                                                  Unit 1 SQL Query Functions[6 hrs]
             NaN                                            1.1. Numeric, String and Date functions
             NaN                                                           1.2. Aggregate Functions
             NaN                                                 1.3. Sorting and Grouping the data
             NaN                                                                                NaN
             NaN                                            Unit 2 Data from multiple tables[5 hrs]
             NaN                                                     2.1. Joins: Inner, Outer, Self
             NaN                                                                   2.2  Sub-queries
             NaN                                                                                NaN
             NaN                              Unit 3  Procedural SQL  and Exception Handling[8 hrs]
             NaN                                                        3.1. PL/SQL Block Structure
             NaN                                    3.1.1. Using Variables, Constants and Data Type
             NaN                              3.1.2. Control Statements :IF...THEN statement, Loop,
             NaN                                                             FOR...Loop, While Loop
             NaN                                     3.2. User-Defined RECORD and TABLE data types.
             NaN                                                                    3.3. Exceptions
             NaN                         3.3.1.  User defined Exceptions and Pre-defined Exceptions
             NaN                                                        3.3.2.  Handling Exceptions
             NaN                                                         3.3.3.  Raising Exceptions
             NaN                                                            3.4. Working with Views
             NaN                                                                                NaN
             NaN                                                Unit 4 Cursors and functions[6 hrs]
             NaN                                       4.1. Concept of Cursors and types of Cursors
             NaN                                                                     4.2. Functions
             NaN                                                          4.2.1. Built-in functions
             NaN                                                      4.2.2. User defined functions
             NaN                                                                                NaN
             NaN                                      Unit 5  Stored Procedures and Triggers[7 hrs]
             NaN                                               5.1 Stored Procedure with parameters
             NaN                                                                       5.2 Triggers
             NaN                                                    5.2.1 Triggers and its benefits
             NaN                                5.2.2  Types of Triggers: Before and After Triggers
             NaN                                                                                NaN
             NaN                                  Unit 6 Transaction Management and Packages[5 hrs]
             NaN                                                6.1 Transaction and System Concepts
             NaN                                          6.2. Desirable Properties of Transactions
             NaN                                                    6.3 Commit, Savepoint, Rollback
             NaN                                                                                NaN

Course\rCode                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Unnamed: 0
               Course\rTitle                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Minor: Emerging Technologies in Computing
                      Credit                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               4(Theory)
          Teaching\rper Week                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   4 Hrs
Minimum\rweeks per\rSemester                                                                                                                                                                                                                      15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
    Last\rReview /\rRevision                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       -
          Purpose of\rCourse The aim of this course is to introduce to the students about the emerging\rtechnologies and upcoming areas of computer science and information\rtechnology. Students will become\rfamiliar with special branches of the field which are future specialization\rareas of their learning.
           Course\rObjective                                                 To Gain understanding about special branches of the IT field.\rTo Gain knowledge AI, Data Science, Information and Cyber Security and\rWeb Mobile technologies.\rTo Understand application areas and future prospects of same branches.
                Pr-requisite                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     NIL
            Course Out\rcome                                                             At the end of the course, student is expected to have understanding about\rthe introductory ideas of AI, Data Science, Information and Cyber\rSecurity, Web Mobile technologies, Cloud Computing and IoT.\ras fields of IT.

Minimum\rweeks per\rSemester                                                                                                15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)

          Purpose of\rCourse The purpose of the course is to make students capable of developing web\rapplications interface using latest designing frameworks, UI/UX tools and\rtechnologies.
           Course\rObjective                                                                                          To provide knowledge of web design concepts and most recent UI/UX\rtools
                Pr-requisite                                                                                                                                                               NIL
            Course Out\rcome                             After completion of this course, the students will be capable of developing\reffective and interactive front end for web applications
